biography.value: A ghost is the soul of a once-living creature, bound to haunt a location, creature, or object from its life.

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 4d6 + @mod type=necrotic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

One &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} that the ghost can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a [[/save cha 13 format=long]] or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn &Reference[undead]{undead}, and it retains its alignment, &Reference[int]{Intelligence}, &Reference[wis]{Wisdom}, &Reference[cha]{Charisma}, and immunity to being &Reference[charmed]{charmed} and &Reference[frightened]{frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Ethereal Sight. The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane, and vice versa.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Incorporeal Movement. The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes [[/damage 1d10 type=force average=true]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
